intro: Strophacanthus collinus, commonly known as the mountain balsam, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
